item.title: Red Hat Quay Registry - Integrate Keycloak
item.description: This guide shows you how to configure Keycloak as an OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider for Red Hat Quay Registry. It covers what to configure in Keycloak, what to put into Quay’s config.yaml (or Operator config), how to verify the login flow, and how to switch your Quay initial/admin account (stored locally in Quay’s DB) to an admin user that authenticates via Keycloak.

item.title: Red Hat Quay Registry - Overview and Installation
item.description:
Red Hat Quay is an enterprise-quality container registry, which is responsible to build, scan, store and deploy containers. The main features of Quay include:

  • High Availability

  • Security Scanning (with Clair)

  • Registry mirroring

  • Docker v2

  • Continuous integration

and much more.
